Title: FULL LIST: Rema, Burna Boy, Yemi Alade win big at 9th AFRIMA Awards
Summary: Nigerian superstars Burna Boy, Rema, Yemi Alade, Shallipopi, Phyno, Qing Madi and Chella clinched major awards at the 9th All Africa Music Awards . Rema picked three awards on the night in Lagos .

Title: Renewed Hope in action: How Tinubu is propelling interior ministry reforms
Summary: On a good day, the National Association of Nigerian Students (NANS) hardly celebrates politicians . But an exception was made recently . Tinubu is propelling interior ministry reforms .

Title: Repeal and re-enactment of 2024, 2025 Appropriation Acts
Summary: Budget Office of the Federation seeks to clarify the legal basis for the repeal and re-enactment . Budget Office sought to clarify legal basis of the repeal of the Act . The Budget Office said it will repeal the 2024, 2025 Appropriation Acts .

Title: Wema Bank launches upgraded  version of ALAT
Summary: Wema Bank Plc launches upgraded version of its flagship digital banking . The bank is the pioneer of Africa’s first full digital bank .

Title: FG set to review tariff policies to boost local production
Summary: The federal government has commenced strategic review of tariff policies . This follows a high-level meeting with the Tariffs Review Board and the Minister of State for Finance, Dr Doris Uzoka-Anite . Existing tariff regimes were weighed against the backdrop of rising production .

Title: AFRIMA 2026: Rema steals show, beats Burna Boy, Davido, Wizkid
Summary: The All Africa Music Awards,AFRIMA, 2026 has crowned its winners, and Rema is the big winner . Rema beats Burna Boy, Davido, Wizkid and Davido .

Summary: Nigerian manufacturers are set to benefit from performance-based incentives with the implementation of the Nigeria Tax Act (NTA) 2025, which took effect from January 1, 2026 . Title: Killings, violence sponsored by opponents of govt — Opadokun
Summary: Killings, violence sponsored by opponents of the government, says Padokun . Padokeun: "The current wave of killings and violence in the country is not accidental"

Title: Nigeria drowning in unpayable debt
Summary: Dele Sobowale: Nigeria drowning in unpayable debt . U.S. is neck-deep in debt; most of its economic leaders-of-thought are convinced that it is only a matter of time before the bubble bursts and a full-blown recession will follow .

Title: Bandits kill soldier, NSCDC officer in Benue
Summary: Bandits, suspected armed herders, have killed a soldier and an officer of the Nigeria Security and Civil Defence Corps . The incident occurred at Udeku community in the Turan district of the Kwande Local Government Area of Benue State . The slain officers were reportedly returning from Aga Market, where they had gone on a motorcycle

Title: Awujale: Ruling house slams KWAM1 over protest letter to Abiodun
Summary: Fuji artiste, Wasiu Ayinde, also known as KWAM1, wrote a protest letter to Ogun State Governor, Dapo Abiodun . He claimed he was being deliberately excluded from the selection process of the next Awujale of Ijebu land . The Fusengbuwa Ruling House

Title: Security forces dismantle bandit networks in Kogi, kill scores
Summary: The Kogi State Police Command said that scores of bandits were neutralised and their networks dismantled during a fresh security operation . The exact location of the exercise was not disclosed . The operation was carried out in an ongoing joint operation involving the police and the military, with support from the Nigeria Police Force Air Wing .

Title: Kano to train 50,000 youths in skills acquisition programme
Summary: The Kano State Government has announced plans to train no fewer than 50,000 youths across the state in 2026 as part of efforts to curb unemployment and promote economic self-reliance . Governor Abba Yusuf disclosed this on Sunday during the distribution of empowerment packages to 2,260 graduates of eight entrepreneurship skills institutes at the Government
